Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: monika40Fremantle
Reviews.Content: These fully serviced apartments are situated in the small Hosking Lane, off Castlereagh Street, 40 metres away from and parallel to Martin Place. Our rooms were on the 4th Floor, were quiet (behind heavy, double sliding glass doors); spacious, well laid-out; well equipped and well maintained. The kitchenette and small self-contained laundry were ideal for a 5 day stay in the middle of four weeks away from home. The storage within the spacious bedroom was ample; the facilities in the lounge area were good and the bathroom, again, roomy and well-equipped. The balcony was small but we did not use it during the cold, wet weather that was the norm in Sydney at this time. The convenience of the location, with Metro and buses and taxis and excellent restaurants and cafes and shops and theatres all readily accessible was another attraction. All the staff we encountered were helpful and friendly. A perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Why would anyone stay in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bucket-Listers2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights.We were not expecting much because of the price in comparison to the hotels in the same area.We were wrong!! The apartment is so much better than staying in a small hotel room with no facilities.We had a full kitchen,washer,dryer and an extra bedroom and a porch.The location is perfect.Halfway between the harbor and Darling Harbor.You can be anywhere in about 10-15 minutes.The internet/wifi is very expensive. We went to McDonalds in Martin Place(1 minute walk).I would stay again at any Medina anywhere after the great room and rates we got.

Reviews.Title: “At home in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: PandC_11
Reviews.Content: I believe this building is shared with full time residents, it seems like they have their own floors and entrance/elevator (it can be confusing where to enter when you first arrive). But once your in, this place is heaven. Early checkin was allowed (great after a trans-pacific flight), extremely quiet (notable for any city hotel), excellent staff, prime central location and has a kitchen (save money, cook dinner in your room!). Our room (a studio) was quite spacious and the bed very comfortable. As others have said there are no views, that's because you're in an alleyway, which is why it is so wonderfully quiet. We were only there a couple nights, but this place would be even better (if that's possible) for extended stays. I would not hesitate to recommend this to my friends - good value, good location, good accommodations. As a hotel should be ...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and facilities, some noise and no views...”
Reviews.Author: jimyuill
Reviews.Content: As you would expect from Medina, the rooms and facilities are top notch and the service provided was excellent. A very central location in the CBD. The only negatives were the bottle bank outside early in the morning and very noisy on the balcony outside on the balcony. But it's not like they advertise a view, so your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: fokky
Reviews.Content: The Medina Classic Martin Place is centrally located in the CBD. Cab ride from the airport was 25 minutes and $47. It works out cheaper than the train when there's three people and it's direct route. The hotel is walking distance to the Circular Quay, Opera House, The Rocks, Royal Botanical Gardens and high end stores. It's right between the stops for the free tourist bus (#555) which loops around the CBD. David Jones, Myers and The Westfield Mall are just a 5 minute walk. Martin Place is also a great people gathering place with just pedestrian traffic. We were booked in a one bedroom for four nights. Room was clean, comfortable and conveniently located. Check-in was a breeze. Front desk staff were friendly and efficient. Kitchen was well equipped and very handy for breakfast and snacks. As commented by others, the location is in a laneway, but is extremely accessible from Pitt, Castlereagh or Martin Place. Yes, the only view is of the office building across. Yes, the garbage trucks come by every morning at 5:30 am and makes a racket for a few minutes. No, the double glazing has not worked. The shower stall has an impossibly high ledge that makes it a challenge to get in and out of the shower. These were the only drawbacks. If one can work around the 5:30 am wake-up call, then the Medina Classic is ideally located to explore Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: AucklandNZ48
Reviews.Content: This establishment is very centrally located in downtown Sydney - you can easily walk to all the main sights, shops, restaurants, shows - you name it. Yes, its front door is down a small street and the building is surrounded by taller buildings so there is no view. We had a one bedroom apartment for 6 nights and it suited us just fine. It had all the necessities for self catering and there is a Coles supermarket 3 blocks away at teh cnr of George and King Streets. Double glazing meant no noise - and to be on the safe side ask for a room away from the elevator. There is a free shuttle bus around central Sydney (route 555) and quickest way from/to the airport is by train (get off at St James for the Medina and then 7-10 min walk - use Google map to get the route to walk). The advance purchase rate was good for Sydney hotels. The only negative is the very high price charged if you want to use internet in your room - a real rip-off. We used free WiFi hot spots at the library and cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for central business district in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: spanky50
Reviews.Content: The hotel allowed us early check-in, which we greatly appreciated. The room was clean, quiet and comfortable. The kitchen was a real plus. There was a washer and dryer in the suite. If you are tired of restaurant food as we were, there is a good grocery store named Coles, just a few blocks from the hotel. Sydney has many sites to see, so get out and walk around if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in CBD”
Reviews.Author: KellyZ
Reviews.Content: The only negative thing I had heard about this hotel was the entrance- Yeah, it's in an alley but it's a safe area. Don't allow this to deter you. MCMP is in the CBD which means it's only a short walk from Circular Quay, The Rocks, Pitt Street Mall...The views from this hotel aren't great, but you'll most likely be out all day anyway. The hotel is very clean, the rooms are very clean, but most of all, the staff were so helpful. I usually shrug off reviews about staff, but when you are in a foreign country and need help, well, the staff are the people to ask. They booked most of our tours for us and made sure that everything was organized. I'd absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Find!”
Reviews.Author: PerthHolidayBuff
Reviews.Content: One bedroom apartment with a sofa bed in living room, adequate for 2 adults and 2 young children. Always friendly staff, very clean apartment, great amenities. Excellent location, short walk to Circular Quay and Westfield Sydney so sightseeing and dining out not a problem at all. There was a balcony with a table and 2 chairs with a view looking into someone's office! Would definetly recommend to friends and family and will stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: xsimx
Reviews.Content: Excellently located about halfway between the main shops on Pitt St, and the harbour. The room was clean and comfortable and had a decent sized kitchen. Laundry facilities are in room with washing machine and tumble drier- ideal if you're staying a few days or travelling. The desk staff were very friendly and helpful, and managed to get our room ready early when we arrived from our flight. I felt the wifi was a little over priced, and could only attach one device to it.

Reviews.Title: “A great location in central Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: shazze
Reviews.Content: This is a little difficult to find as the wee lane that its on is not shown on most maps/apps. It's very close to the Wynyard station, there being a short-cut through an unmarked alleyway just across the road- look for the sign for the magic shop, by the chemist/pharmacy. We found the apartment a little noisy some nights with continuous arrivals of rubbish trucks which hoisted bins of bottles which crashed when tipped in, but it was quieter on the weekend nights. The shower was an issue as it has a very high frame around what is essentially a square tub, and is difficult to get in and out of (we are tall and able-bodied). Otherwise, its clean, basically equipped and the staff are pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, Clean”
Reviews.Author: HelloKitty1205
Reviews.Content: We traveled with three adults and the one bedroom apartment was very comfy. The location was perfect one block from George St and about a 15 minutes walk to the Opera House and The Rocks. All the staff was very nice and proffessional, they even lend us their personell umbrella.

Reviews.Title: “OMG”
Reviews.Author: sydney69England
Reviews.Content: Location is awful. Sometimes apparently even the taxis can't find it. Tight little side road nearly touching office building opposite. The apartment itself was well appointed so no complaints there. The building is in the CBD so everything closes after office hours. The building has no restaurant/cafe or swimming pool. It does however have a "multigym" in the basement!!! Top Tip - put some clothes on before you open your curtains otherwise the office workers will see you in all your glory!!!

Reviews.Title: “Central, Clean, Quiet & Spacious”
Reviews.Author: Peter S
Reviews.Content: I visited Sydney and needed somewhere central to shops & handy to Circular Quay. I like to stay in serviced apartments to open up the eating options and for the additional space. This was my first time at the Medina Martin Place (but I had previously stayed at the Medina Executive). Location wise itâ€™s incredibly central. Itâ€™s pretty well hidden which helps keep it quiet. There are really good public transport options (Bus and rail at Martin Place). I had a one bedroom apartment with separate lounge, diner, kitchen with a good size bedroom & bathroom. The bathroom had a shower but no bath. The whole place was very clean and functional we had an exceptionally large balcony â€“ could have hosted a cocktail party! The Staff were very helpful and sorted out any problems quickly & efficiently.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and convenient”
Reviews.Author: PerthVincents
Reviews.Content: We just spent one night at Medina but were impressed with room cleanliness and size. Everything there for a longer stay. Convenient location, very central. Staff helpful and even posted my mobile charger back to me, which I left behind. Would recommend for a mid-range hotel at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bang for the Dollar”
Reviews.Author: LoydDobbler
Reviews.Content: This place is a score. It's a little tough to find, and with a car I guess you have to pay for parking. We had no car, and we loved this place. Amazing location for the cost of the room. I can't imagine you will find a better deal. Warren is a pro at the front desk, and the entire staff was great. I've only been to Sydney once, but I highly recommend this place. Internet is a little high, but that was consistent all across Australia, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “CBD location, average turist hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peterson76
Reviews.Content: A bit hided in an alley right in the middle of the CBD. Average turist hotel. Nothing specially good, but nothing specially bad neither.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment right in the centre of town”
Reviews.Author: SteveRBristol
Reviews.Content: Spot on central position 5 mins walk from the Quay, Opera house and Harbour bridge. A huge apartment with everything you could wish for, even complimentary milk in the fridge. Particularly liked the food menus thoughtfully supplied and stuck on the fridge. Would deffo recommend and would suggest this to be a fantastic alternative to a hotel room, even better if several people were sharing.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, self contained, and central.”
Reviews.Author: mieke w
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights. Very Clean, spacious practical appartments. Friendly staff. Very central location. Double glazing meant an undisturbed sleep. Location is down a service lane, but always felt safe. Shame about the local smokers who litter the street with dozens of cigarettebuds.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Anna H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 5 nights in this clean, spacious hotel and were completely pleased. The location is great - near lots of public transportation and within walking distance of many major sites. We were on the 7th floor. Our one bedroom apartment with completely furnished kitchen, washer and dryer was spotless. Although we didn't use the washer & dryer, it was good to know they were available. I had read reviews in which some complaints were made about the staff and the noise. We found the staff to be very courteous and extremely helpful and we slept so well that if there was noise in the street, it didn't bother us. The office building across the street was not a problem either because the windows had curtains & drapes which could be closed. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and plan to check out other Medina hotels when we travel to other cities.

Reviews.Title: “Sooooo central!”
Reviews.Author: Sharon R
Reviews.Content: My two teenage children and I stayed 6 nights in October 2011 in a one bedroom spacious and well furnished apartment on the second floor.The sofa bed was readymade. The kitchen was well-equipped and great for cooking meals when not eating out. We used the balcony and appreciated the doubled glazed balcony doors which kept noise to a minimum. The staff were always helpful. A great plus was that we were able to walk to all city locations-very central! One negative was the obvious breaking of rules by neighbours who smoked in their rooms which filtered through.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location but expensive internet access!”
Reviews.Author: Ottawop
Reviews.Content: Internet access here is very expensive, so I'd recommend that you simply drop by the State Libary of New South Wales, just a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Access there is free and opening hours are fairly long. We booked through Booking.com which was cheaper than booking directly with the hotel. When we booked the standard 1 bedroom, didn't realize it only came in 1 queen bed configuration. So when we asked for a room with 2 beds, they said 'sure'. They just downgraded us to a studio without telling us and without refunding any money. Would have been nice to have been informed about the room change and maybe even given the option to pay the difference for a Superior 1-bedroom. Rooms are dark as this hotel is crammed between other tall buildings in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Take A Good Pair of Earplugs”
Reviews.Author: N0rwichTraveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in a one bedroom apartment on the first floor for 4 nights at the start of 3 weeks travelling in Australia (early August 2011). The rooms are a good size and were well furnished and the location within the heart of the CBD was great for accessing all the sights but we found one major problem - the noise. I had read a number of reviews before we booked the hotel mentioning that this was a issue but we thought it couldn't be that bad. Unfortunately we were wrong. The hotel (and all rooms from what I could work out) face on the small road with service entry's into the adjacent office block. We were awoken each morning at 4:30am to the beeping sound of reversing refuse lorries. This continued with a lorry every 20 minutes or so for the rest of the morning. Having travelled non-stop from the UK we were struggling with jet lag which meant getting back to sleep was that much more difficult and we were left feeling tired for days. I noted there were comments from the management regarding installation of double glazing but this was not the case for our room. If the management could reduce the noise this would be a really good hotel but in the meantime I won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodation in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 3HappyKiwis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Medina Classic in November 2010. Had read the trip advisor reviews decided to go ahead and book. I am so glad we did - was just perfect. The rooms were impecably clean and very well appointed. Had full kitchen was just excellent. Our fridge stopped working and within 20 minutes they were at the door with another one. The location is great very handy to Martin Place railway station and walking distance from Darling Harbour and all the great shops in Central Sydney as well as the Rocks and the Opera House. There was no excessive noise that we noticed. The staff were so helpful and friendly nothing was a problem Was the perfect place for a girls weekend but I would also stay here if on a trip with my family. Would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Bigbluesea
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Medina classic in our brief visit to Sydney and it was awesome, nice big rooms, great location, good value, staff were very friendly, we weren't bothered by the noise The all, would love to stay again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Bintang_Girl
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for 5 nights on a business trip in a one bedroom apartment. The location was great for trains, buses, shops, a 5min walk to Circular Quay & ferries, 10-15min walk to Darling Harbour. The hotel is located down a short narrow street which then turns into a walking lane through to Pitt St. Pros: Full kitchen, full laundry, king size bed, wardrobe & safe, lounge/living area with TV, stereo, sofa lounge, work desk, dining table & chairs, small balcony to smoke on (only views of office buildings all around), air con, iron & ironing board, hair dryer. Daily room service. Cons: very expensive internet (i think free wifi should be available in hotels these days), expensive continental breakfast pack (optional), very high 40-50cm step up to get into shower over small square bath. Great hotel for a business trip or a visit to Sydney if you dont require a room with a view. No street noise was heard in my room (room 607) unless the balcony doors were open.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RichardBNE
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was located in a little alleyway just off Martin Place in Sydney!! The room was spacious and furnished exquisitely. Hotel staff were very friendly and accomodating and location was perfect! Right in the heart of Sydney City!! Would absolutely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “lovely spacious modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: Kylie D
Reviews.Content: Great location, very comfortable and pretty quiet. Bathroom and shower bit of a let down. Difficult to get into the updated shower alcove over the bath, very poor shower pressure.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, down an alley.”
Reviews.Author: hazza55
Reviews.Content: While the studio apartment itself was fine, with good kitchen facilities, king bed and plenty of space this hotel had some serious drawbacks. First, the location. The hotel is in the centre of the business district but the entrance is down a very unappealing alley. I am familiar with Sydney and thus was not overly concerned at the location but if you were not familiar with the city I don't think you would be happy walking down there late at night. Second the alley did a dog leg turn past the hotel that led it out, past the dumpsters and the back of the table dancing club, to the next street. This provides a shortcut for drunken young revellers late at night who like to sing, play cricket, swear, urinate and whatever else as they make their way past your balcony/window. Next, this isn't the only noise that interrupted our sleep. Being down an alley and thus near the utility area of adjoing buildings we got to hear staff coming and going from other building, deliveries, etc.. Another problem with our room was that mobile phone coverage and data reception was terrible - to the extent that we couldn't use our iPhones for either calls or internet. And we are with one of the two major providers. Finally, when checking out we were charged a 1.5 percent surcharge for using a credit card. Who doesn't pay with credit cards nowadays? And who in their right mind would be wandering up and down city alleyways with thousands of dollars in their pockets to pay hotel bills? The staff were friendly and helpful and the room itself was fine but these drawbacks are deal breakers. I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: unclebuckMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Fantastic appartment. Quiet location, clean and very spacious. Great staff. We will definitely stay here again when we next come to Sydney. Did not hear any garbage trucks at all even though we were facing the side alley.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and great location”
Reviews.Author: stgeorge79
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a one bedroom apartment which was very nice but our view was of an office building. At night it can get very noisy due to drunks hanging out in lane way but it's close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Clean Spacious units, BRILLIANT!”
Reviews.Author: mcellisnz
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in a studio unit for 6 nights and were extremely impressed with the 24 hour desk service, Spacious CLEAN rooms, daily room service and everything about the whole place! The location is excellent - right in the central city within easy walking distance to most places. Public transport is right at your fingertips which made getting around EASY! The only small complaint was that the fridge made 'popping' noises as it went through the defrost cycle, and was loud during the night, but that wouldn't matter if you are in a 1 or 2 bedroom apartment, only effected us because we were in a studio. (Ear plugs did the trick though). The fully equipped kitchen and laundry facilities were a bonus considering the room was a studio. We will definitely come again and have absolutely no hesitation in recommending Medina on Martin Place to others. Thanks very much to ALL of the staff for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Clean cheap accom in good location”
Reviews.Author: patullose
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the medina for a long weekend and enjoyed my stay! Rooms are of a good quality and the hotel is located in the heart of the CBD, appartments have balconies which is a rare but good thing to find in CBD appartments, hotel is located off the main road so other then the few cars that drive down the road you are not exposed to much traffic noise,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room in great location.”
Reviews.Author: carl0086
Reviews.Content: The Medina is an excellent chain and the Martin Place location is no exception. I got a one bedroom apartment for a vacation and Sydney and it was just what I needed. The rooms are a good size and there's plenty of room to relax in the separate living room. I didn't use the kitchen, other than the fridge, but it seemed well equipped. The bathroom was spacious and having your own washer and dryer is a big reason to pick Medina. The shower does have a big step to get into but there are plenty of towels. The location is superb, right in the heart of Sydney. You're a three minute walk to the free bus that takes you throughout Sydney and I highly recommend that. You can also walk comfortably from Darling Harbour or The Rocks. It's about ten minutes to either location. The hotel's entrance is down a very small, one block street that I see has bothered other reviewers but I had no issues with it. It was perfectly safe. There was a trash pickup of the next door office building each night but a little bit of noise between eight and nine at night is not an issue for me at a downtown hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. As is usual with international arrivals, I got there very early and my room wasn't ready but they stored my luggage and did checkin. So when I returned in the afternoon the luggage was neatly placed in my room and all I had to do was get my key. The person working the desk even remembered my name and room so they just handed me the key, a very nice touch. They also had maps and other information that newcomers to Sydney might want. I needed a cab and they got one to me right away. I highly recommend this hotel because of its location. You'll save money by staying here instead of the usual tourist locations of Darling Harbour and The Rocks, yet both locations are easily accessible by foot and free bus. There are also plenty of restaurants and tourist locations reachable by foot.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, Spacious Rooms.... Staff were disappointing”
Reviews.Author: sodababy1
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Medina over the weekend, found the rooms absolutely beautiful. All the comforts of home. Bed was amazing, lounge area was comfortable and the balcony was huge. The only disappointment was the lack of interest from the staff. Most appeared to be too busy and too important to deal with us. Namely, Rachana on the front desk - upon check in, she was rude and made us feel like we were wasting her time. During check in, she even walked off on us and never came back. Not one of the house keepers acknowledged me throughout the stay, most just stared at me and then looked away without a hello or a smile. Despite the staff, I was there for a weekend away, so I didnt mind this too much. Noise complains in previous Trip Advisor reviews I didnt encounter. The room was quiet and serene. I definitely recommend staying here if you want a relaxing weekend away without any interaction from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “relaxed and comfortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: grandg
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my grand son and found this hotel a very comfortable place to stay. The rooms were large, plenty of room for him to play. The service was good when we arrived tired and had a problem with our room, it was sorted quickly and with no fuss. . There were some mosiquitos which was a shame as we had not had the doors open. Also getting there by train was difficult as Martin Place does not have a lift which made it hard with small child, pram and luggage and when I asked the staff on checkout to arrange a taxi to go to the railway station she told me it would take to long and I should take the train but overall the service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: Lugrabr
Reviews.Content: Very clean and staff very friendly and helpful to organize all your needs. Very good price. A little bit noisy but it's ok.

Reviews.Title: “Very practical and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: SoJakarta
Reviews.Content: It's a great hotel, practical for families. The rooms are large, with a fully independent bedroom and good amenities (washer in the room for example). It's not charming but very practical, and the location is ideal to visit Sydney. We had a room facing a roof from which the AC units of the opposite building were working, so it was quite noisy if the window was open and did not give a good view. However this minor disagreement was totally outweighed by the practicality of the room

Reviews.Title: “Central”
Reviews.Author: YIWAN
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night, 5th December. I arrived JUST BEFORE 2pm, then met up with other guests also booked in for that night, but none of us were allowed to go to our rooms until 2pm.... like.... in ten minutes time! We all had to be at a meeting across town at 2pm.... so we had to leave without booking in. The staff offered to store bags and let us use a toilet in the basement. Looked like a staff bathroom.... Once I finally got to my room, LATE that night, it was great. Fresh milk in the fridge. Kitchen, laundry, bedroom, bathroom, lounge room and huge balcony. BUT the shower was over a DEEP square tub that I found difficult to climb into. And the glass shower-door opened awkwardly onto the taps.... The manager and front desk staff were VERY kind and helpful the next day, ringing airport transportation, looking after my bag all day after I checked out at 10am, and calling a cafe to find my glasses that I had lost there.... Would LOVE to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Aircard Shadow and Expensive In-House Internet”
Reviews.Author: JaykUSAandAustralia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is burried amongst tall buildings. I could not recieve a signal on my aircard and had to purchase the hotel's internet service, which cost $25.

Reviews.Title: “Take Earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: Aussietraveller5
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location right behind Martin Place and is very clean. we rented a one bedroom apartment on the 5th floor which was very simple but well priced. Unfortunately throughout the night the neighboring buildings had their rubbish bins emptied which was so bad it even woke my partner up who sleeps through most things. The staff admitted this is a real problem and we were lucky that after two nights of no sleep they were able to move us to a corner room which did not have the same level of noise. The staff were very helpful but I think the owners of this chain need to spend some money on soundproofing the windows of their properties as this is the second of their properties we have stayed at where noise has been a big issue.

Reviews.Title: “Ok as a base... if you can find it”
Reviews.Author: TWMC2010
Reviews.Content: The medina offers self service apartments that give you all that you need for a self catering stay complete with your own laundry, the hotel is in a central location but not that easy to find as it is down a back street that looks like it is just used for deliveries. There are not really any views from the hotel but then you are not paying for a waterfront location, as a place to stay it is fine and has all that you need, you will spend most of your time out in the city and most places are just a short walk away. It's a bad spot if you have a car as there is no parking and the public car parks in Sydney are not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location in the heart of the CBD”
Reviews.Author: dhphllps
Reviews.Content: This is in a great location, a couple blocks from the Martin Place station and an easy walk from Sydney Opera House and the ferry terminal. It's a little hard to find, being at the end of a short dead end alley, and when I emailed in advance asking for advice on airport transportation and directions they were not particularly helpful, saying only to "take the train." The suite was compact and basic, but complete. We were able to fix meals and do laundry in the room, which certainly helped the budget. The "view" from the room was of an office building maybe 15 meters away across the street, and there was a fair amount of street noise on the 6th (top) floor. As a place to sleep, it can't be beat. If you're looking for a luxury resort experience, look elsewhere. The staff were very warm, welcoming and helpful, and the price is great for the location.

Reviews.Title: “central to most places”
Reviews.Author: diane90
Reviews.Content: We had never stayed here before so when a travel site was offering a special deal we decided to book it. We loved the location as it was close to major attractions. The one bedroom apt was very comfy, and we loved the fresh milk that was supplied to go with tea and coffee, i hate the long life milk. The receptionists were very helpful and went out of their way to help. The only downside, which is minor, was the shower over the bath. The bath is very high and might be difficult for older people to get in. The balconies were the biggest i have seen in an apt.

Reviews.Title: “Back alley location is hardly alluring”
Reviews.Author: miniappleses
Reviews.Content: If this hotel could be transplanted into a different setting, it would be fantastic. The staff was endlessly friendly and helpful (recommending supermarkets, booking airport shuttles, fixing a stuck door) and the apartment was clean and comfortable, but its spot in a back alley meant that our room on the first floor landed us views of the dumpster and all-night bright lights from the parking garage opposite our window. Other minor quibbles include a layout that's not very conducive to a dinner table and a lack of amenities (pool, breakfast, etc), but overall we were very happy with the room itself - just not what's outside the front doors.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, spacious, great location and value”
Reviews.Author: NZFrequentFlyer
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a Studio Unit on the 2nd floor (facing Hosking Place) on Friday and Saturday nights. The apartment was well presented, clean and tidy. Everything was there from full kitchen to washing machine and dryer. The room also had a small enclosed balcony, although nothing to really look at from it. Other reviews stated noisy trucks etc. I didn't notice any during the two nights I stayed and the small lane/road to the apartment was ok and not really imposing. The only problem I had was that I had quested an extra hour on the morning of my checkout, which was on ANZAC day, so I could see more of the parade prior to getting ready to leave. When I asked if it was possible for 1 extra hour I was given a direct "NO". they did not even check to see if the room had new guests arriving, just "NO". Other than this, it was great value and great location.

Reviews.Title: “More a motel than a hotel”
Reviews.Author: hails_79
Reviews.Content: For budget hotel in Sydney's business district this place isn't bad. The facilities are limited and the side street location is a bit dodgy at night. If you can get a cheap rate it's worth it. The self-contained room has a full kitchen which is handy for longer stays.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Welcoming & Cosy”
Reviews.Author: KJRajah
Reviews.Content: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at these apartments. The service was friendly and welcoming. Every day the person at the desk said good morning and in the evening they acknowledged us with a smile and a good evening. I felt connected to the staff because of this and felt them very easy to engage with. The hotel is located in easy walking distance from Circular Quay and inner city shopping. It is down a small ally, off Castlereagh street, nestled amongst office buildings and skyscrapers. Our room was cosy and spacious, and being on the 7th floor meant we had a view beyond the office building that keeps its blinds closed directly opposite the aparments. What I least liked about the room was that the taps in both the shower and basin were bothersome. They were difficult to use, and at times I had to use a flannel to turn them off and on. The shower was a good pressure, but it took a while to reach the right mix of both cold and hot due to the temperamental nature of the taps. It seemed though the chambermaid had arms of steel, because, before our day's adventures we often had to succumb to leaving our poor shower head dripping, but every afternoon, without fail, when we returned to the apartment we were greated with a quiet stillness (beyond the bustling hum of Sydney outside,of course) and found the shower head completely dry, without leakage. It was quite amusing, and I give credit to the chambermaid, but do hope the maintanence people attend at some point to the taps. What I liked most was that the room was modern and functional and it felt like a home away from home, which, I think, is in alignment with its vision.

Reviews.Title: “disruptive noise throughout the night”
Reviews.Author: travel80r
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 nights for work. On arrival, the reception for the apartments present as dingy, down an alleyway, not helped by some construction being done overhead, so the alleway really seems like a lane to nowhere. The reception is small and unimpressive and smelled slightly. The rooms are spacious, and basic, but pleasant. All this would have been ok, but i got 2 of the worst nights sleep on a business trip in memory. Each night I was disrupted by the sounds of Sydney City garbage trucks. The second night was a 2am garbage truck service, a 4 am delivery by diesel truck down the alleway to a restaurant, plus recycling pick-up or some such thing and a 6am garbage truck again. For the price, I'll be staying at a 5 star hotel elsewhere albeit in a smaller room just to get some sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Really good location”
Reviews.Author: jobanoonoos
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Medina for one night on business. The standout feature of these apartments are their proximity to the Sydney CBD - you're right in the heart of things. The front desk were prompt and helpful, recommending local restaurants for dinner and breakfast. On the down side, there were a few noise issues. A noise (sounding like an alarm) sounded at about 6am, lasting for around 3 minutes (pity my alarm wasn't meant to go off for another hour!) also, the plumbing in the room next to mine emitted a horrid screeching sound as my neighbour showered. Nonetheless, the stay was fine, especially for business purposes.

Reviews.Title: “I hoped stay there more days”
Reviews.Author: Yae
Reviews.Content: I feel comfortable and convenience. I enjoyed cooking and shopping material.

Reviews.Title: “Dark, dingy and noisy”
Reviews.Author: MissBoo
Reviews.Content: The down side of the medina marting place is the location. Right in the middle of the business district and surrounded by tall buildings meaning that you never get any sunlight. Plus your room is opposite a large office block so you open your curtains to see people at work at their desk. Be prepared to be woken up from 2am - 6am with loud rubbish collections right outside your window most nights. Having stayed at other medina apartments this one is just in the wrong location and in nead of a bit of a makeover.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great room!!”
Reviews.Author: gleeper
Reviews.Content: A real gem. Serviced apartments of the highest quality, friendly helpful staff, superb location just off Martin Place. Stay here, you will not be disappointed!!! 10/10 for the Medina serviced apartments!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: eliz0685
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel for the Australia Day long weekend. Neither of us had been to Sydney before. We found the hotel extremely easily and it was in a fantastic location. Very handy to public transport, shopping and the main Sydney attractions. We booked a one bedroom appartment and were given a room on the third floor. It did get a bit noisy when the garbage trucks came, but other than that the appartment was clean and tidy. The kitchen was very nice and the bed was quite comfortable. I'll be staying there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious apartment in noisy CBD”
Reviews.Author: LndnCalling03
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to stay in the CBD to be within walking distance of most of the things we wanted to see in Sydney and we were worried that King's Cross would be too noisy. We selected the Medina because of its location and reviews of spacious rooms. Yes, our one bedroom apartment was spacious and clean, and yes the location was excellent. However, we had a very difficult time getting a good night's sleep there. Each night a garbage truck or recycling truck would collect dumpsters in the alley where the hotel is located. The trucks always came between 11 PM and 5 AM. We were on the 4th floor and found this noise to be very disturbing. It's hard to fully enjoy a vacation when you are awakened in the middle of the night by the sound of churning glass. The next time I am in Sydney I will try a different hotel and request to be on a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “Old, tired, shabby accommodation”
Reviews.Author: MACS77B
Reviews.Content: Because a hotel is old it need not be shabby and grubby. We stayed for one night recently and so pleased it was not for any longer. On checking into room found long black hair all over the white bed linen. The friendly receptionist came up to the room and commented , "Oh that wil be the housekeepers hair!!" We were offered a larger room on a higher floor and while there was no hair evident on the bed the whole room was less than spotless. The shower was grubby, and as another reviewer has mentioned you would not walk around in bare feet. Location was perfect, but definitely hard to find. A glass in the kitchen needed to be washed before you could drink out of it. If management made some effort to refurbish this property and give it a really good clean it may tempt people to stay more than once.

Reviews.Title: “It's clean, tidy, central and good value for your $$”
Reviews.Author: CamilleJeanPierre
Reviews.Content: Bottom line? I would highly recommend this place. Itâ€™s very good value for money in a great central location affording very convenient access to all areas. Youâ€™re well placed for either a 10 minute stroll to The Rocks and old Sydney micro-brewery heaven; or an after work G&T with the CBD crowd during the week thatâ€™s right on your doorstep; or a pleasant stroll down the shopping Mecca of Pitt & George Streets to China Town, Darling Harbour or across to the seedy Kingâ€™s Cross or yuppie Surry Hills. The Medina was easy and quick to check in (especially cool after that 24hr flight from Blighty) and I stayed in a studio apartment. So what is a studio apartment exactly? Well, itâ€™s a large hotel bedroom with a well appointed kitchen (for two people) and a decent sized bathroom with powerful shower. The bed was made into a large double and sat opposite the flat screen TV, HiFi, table and computer access points. Thereâ€™s a washing machine and dryer lurking behind cupboards in the bathroom. The negatives are that the broadband is not wifi and is very expensive ($24 a day!!). This is especially annoying because Sydney is somewhat lacking on wifi hotspots and cheap access â€“ itâ€™s there but you have to hunt for it. The TV channels are limited in number but you get the basic cable package. And the room is a little starved of light due to its location amongst the high rise office blocks of the CBD. The rubbish trucks can be a little noisy in the morning if you have your window open but Iâ€™m a city boy so it didnâ€™t bother me. In fact, over my six night stay I didnâ€™t notice much noise at all on the 7th Floor. Iâ€™d come back here without a doubt and Iâ€™d have no worries advising you to try this place too. Itâ€™s clean (although the sheets could have been cleaner), tidy, central and cool for your $$.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value; Dark Room”
Reviews.Author: sbond
Reviews.Content: The Medina Martin Place is situated down a narrow alleyway behind Martin Place with a 5min parking zone so you can unload your luggage. Parking is at the Westin about a block away ($30 per day). We stayed Thurs-Sat nights with our baby. The rates were very inexpensive (we used our entertainment card through Origin Energy) - around $170-180 per night. Our check-in was excellent - smooth, pleasant and easy. Our suite was very nice - clean, modern and a good size with kitchen, living area and separate bedroom. The bathroom let the room down a little with its ugly dated beige tiles, but it was perfectly functional. The room also has an unnecessary enclosed balcony that overlooks the dark alleyway. Little sunlight enters the suite and you need to have the lights on at all times. I ordered 'room service' from the Japanese restaurant next door and it was excellent - fantastic fresh food, bento box, for $25.80, free delivery. The room also came with a small carton of milk which was ideal. The location is also ideal - just seconds away from Martin Place and the downtown shopping hub. The major problem for me was the noise at night. You have to expect that a downtown hotel will be noisy, so I can't really complain, but in the interests of full disclosure, I woke frequently to street cleaners, garbage trucks, breaking bottles, trucks backing up, and on the Saturday night, drunk people screaming in the alleyway (probably fighting over the car parks!) and an extremely loud bang (I can't have been a gun but sounded like it). I didn't mention the noise to management. We stayed on the first floor, so I would recommend a higher floor to perhaps avoid some of the nighttime noise. Although the suite was great value, next time I would probably stay at the slightly more expensive Medina on Crown St in Surry Hills.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: Ganagirl
Reviews.Content: Not your average review BUT I feel it should be written. I booked for 2 nights and was upgraded to a 1 bed apartment. Great location for getting about in town and pleasant, efficient reception team. On the second day I had a very unexpected, very serious illness while in the hotel and the hotel team were absolutely amazing. I was traveling alone and it was all very frightening for me. They simply rose to the challenge and responded with calm, genuine care and thoughtfulness making it far less traumatic than it could have been. I was so impressed with the lady who sat with me until the emergency services arrived - yes it was that serious! - she helped me call and locate friends in Sydney, stayed calm which helped me in turn stay calm and was incredibly kind and supportive throughout I know we should expect this, but everyday in the news we see that this doesn't happen, that people aren't helped when they really need it...so I am very very grateful to this team of people and this hotel chain, who instill this kind of customer care. Very grateful. And I made a full recovery.

Reviews.Title: “Large Apartments-Handy location to Martin Place Underground station”
Reviews.Author: ozcookie1
Reviews.Content: Was booked here on business in April. Arrived at around 1130 and they had just cleaned the room so was allowed to check in. Staff at reception were pleasant but unusally the front door was kept locked and if you did not have a key you needed to be 'buzzed in' which I didn't even see during the daytime in Europe and the USA recently (you expect it at night). Room was huge and a lovely internal balcony the size of a room. Room was a little dated and I thought it was clean until i discovered toilet paper unflushed. That was a small issue as I loved the space and the full kitchen. Didn't have much time to spend in the room but the continental breakfast basket was nice. Staff allowed me to store my bags until my flight which was good. Good apartments for business or if you like the space and very close to Martin Place station. Other people at my meeting were also booked here and I heard complaints about the hot water but the water in my room was fine .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ramzilla
Reviews.Content: The Medina Martin Place represents good value for money in an excellent location smack in the middle of the Sydney CBD. Itâ€™s happily situated with an easy walk to bus, train and ferry, major galleries, department stores, cinema and theatres. Plenty of restaurants, take away places, bars, convenience stores and a Coles supermarket. I stayed 10 nights. Reception was friendly and helpful. Anything I asked of them was quickly and efficiently handled. The serviced apartment was comfortable, clean and adequately appointed, perhaps a little tired but still great value for money in comparison to other serviced apartments in which Iâ€™ve stayed in Sydney. I would have liked a DVD player, but then I wasnâ€™t in Sydney to sit in the room watching DVDs. My apartment was on the 2nd floor, the only downside is the room was very dark â€“ no views. I just left the lights on â€“ not very eco friendly, but beats sitting in half gloom. It can be noisy at night â€“ garbage collection a couple of times a week. Coming up for Xmas there were also noisy revelers around the area. The window glazing and very large balcony was an almost adequate baffle. A new internet service was in shake down during my visit. It was cost effective and an improvement on the previous offering. Iâ€™m an ex Sydneysider and return for 3-10 day stints a couple of times a year. Iâ€™ve stayed here before and will happily stay again based upon its value for money and excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic spot”
Reviews.Author: stuartSydney
Reviews.Content: This place is great. It is in one of the best places in the city - I agree that it is tricky to find in a cab but if you told them Hosking place is off Castlereagh street between Hunter and Martin Place it might help. You couldn't be more central if you tried - literally 1 minute walk onto Martin Place smack bang in the middle of Sydney. Apartments are very well fitted out - full kitchen and laundry facilities and exceptionally clean. You have no view at all from these units as they look onto office blocks - and a high floor is recommended if possible so you can get more natural light - but overall a fantastic place to stay in the best city in the world !

Reviews.Title: “Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: Joanna21
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a 12 night stay at this hotel and i found it fantastic! Arrived in Sydney in the early hours of the morning. The taxi driver had no idea where the hotel was and had me lookin at a map book for it, after riding round the streets we eventually got there at around 9.30am. Check in wasnt while 2pm but we thought we'd go and see if the room was ready. We were greated by friendly reception staff who immedatley contacted the cleaner to make sure our room was ready and was allowed in - a big relief as we were so tired. We were in a studio room - 404 on the fourth floor. The room was large and spacious, there is a chest of drawers and a large wardrobe, then a bathroom with a laundry room, Then was the kitchen which was very well equipeped. Fridge freezer, dishwasher, microwave and then a large living space with double bed. The view wasnt of much - a man sat at his desk in the office opposite, didnt bother us tho as we were out all the time. The room was very clean, in a previous comment it was mentioned that the carpet was dirty as was the bathroom, we didnt have this problem the room was spotless, The room was cleaned everyday! It can be noisy outside with rubbish trucks etc but its not a huge problem. The only problem i had was the fridge could be noisy at night but you soon got used to it! The hotel is on a side street and you do worry a bit as you walk to it but once your on the main road the location is ideal. Martins Place is the next street, and the train station is there too. Circular Quay, darling Harbour etc are all close by (10-15min walk). Hotel is central so can be busy with workers. Loads of places nearby to eat and a coles supermarket a couple of blocks away! All in all a great central place to stay especially if you can get it at the right price, we paid Â£65 a night! Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Fussypot13
Reviews.Content: I travel very frequently to Sydney for business reasons and have stayed at the Medina Classic on several occasions. Rooms aren't very clean, especially the bathrooms, lots of hair in the corners and on the rool (of all places) I would never walk around without shoes on as the carpet has seen better days, the beds are very old and saggy, there are scuff marks on the walls and overall I would say it is quite "grimmy". I find the rooms to be very very noisy, it is situated up a lane way and during the night you have the garbage trucks emptying the bins, this includes the emptying of glass bins, and that is very loud. The hot water in the shower takes a long time to kick in and the shower head is so small that you need to perform some sort of magic trick to get all your hair wet. I often have problems with the card pass not working on the door, this is frustrating as you need to wait an incredibly long time for the lift to come. Not somewhere that I would recommend to business people as you are guaranteed to get a night of constant interruption.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 1 night after a long overnight flight from Hong Kong. We arrived on Saturday morning before check-in time but I was relieved when they allowed us to go to our room right away. The lady who checked us in was very friendly. Coming from Hong Kong, where space is a premium, I really liked the large living room, open kitchen and large bathroom. I thought the bedroom was a little small but who cares if you can hang out in the living room? If you're petite or if you're a kid you might need a stool to climb into the bathtub (which comes w/ a shower). They gave us everything we needed in the kitchen - large refridgerator, stove, pots & pans, cutlery, etc. They even gave us lots of menus to choose from if we wanted to order dinner from the neighborhood delivery service. The best part of the hotel was the location. Although the hotel is located in a dead-end street it's a 1 minute to Chifley Plaza, a short walk to David Jones, Myer.... the shopping district. My husband and I spent Sunday walking around and made a few trips back to the hotel to drop off our shopping bags. We lost track of time and returned to the hotel 2 hours after the check-out time. We couldn't get into our rooms because our "keys" (cards) had expired but they re-activated our cards and didn't even mention the fact that we had forgotten to check-out on time when we checked out! We also couldn't complain about the rate (AUD145). The hotel is a short walk from everything (CBD, shopping, Circular Quay, The Rocks, etc.) I wouldn't mind staying here on long business trips.

HotelInfo.Name: Medina Classic Martin Place
HotelInfo.Address: 1 Hosking Place, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
